title: 7 Simple Steps to Remove an Apple ID Phone Number on an iPhone

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings . It's the gray gear icon on your Home screen. Use this method if you want to change or remove the phone number used for 2-step verification and account recovery for your Apple Account. You will only be able to remove the phone number if it is not linked to iMessage or FaceTime .

steps.title: Tap your name.
steps.content: Tap your name. It's at the top of the Settings menu.

steps.title: Tap Sign-In & Security.
steps.content: Tap Sign-In & Security . It'll be near the top of the list below your name and email address.

steps.title: Tap the phone number you want to remove.
steps.content: Tap the phone number you want to remove. This displays options for that phone number. If you haven't already added a new phone number, you will want to do that first.

steps.title: Tap Remove from Account.
steps.content: Tap Remove from Account . You will be prompted to select or enter a new phone number. [1] X Research source If you don't see this option, the phone number you're trying to remove is in use by Messages and/or FaceTime. Jump down to Removing from Messages & FaceTime to learn how to select a different phone number or email address for those services. After that, you can return to this method to remove your phone number from your Apple account.

steps.title: Enter or select a new phone number.
steps.content: Enter or select a new phone number. Make sure you can currently access the new phone number so you can verify it if necessary.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions to verify.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions to verify. If the phone number you select is not already verified, Apple will text a code to that number. If you don't receive a code, this means you've already verified the phone number, and it's ready to use. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Change your Apple Account password.
steps.content: Change your Apple Account password. If iMessage texts, FaceTime calls, or other Apple communications are going to an iPhone you no longer have, you can quickly remove it by changing your Apple account password . [3] X Research source You can do this using any web browser at https://account.apple.com . Just sign in with your Apple Account username and password, select Sign-in and Security , click Password , and follow the on-screen instructions. Changing your Apple Account password removes all phone numbers from your Apple devices. If you have a new phone number, be sure to add it to iMessage and FaceTime.

steps.title: Deregister iMessage.
steps.content: Deregister iMessage. If you switched to an Android phone from an iPhone and are having trouble receiving texts, you may have left your phone number registered to iMessage. If you no longer have the phone, you can deregister it at https://selfsolve.apple.com/deregister-imessage .

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings . It's the gray gear icon on your Home screen. Use this method if you want to remove a phone number from the Messages app or FaceTime.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Apps.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Apps . It's all the way at the bottom of the Settings menu.

steps.title: Select FaceTime.
steps.content: Select FaceTime . This displays your FaceTime settings.

steps.title: Remove your phone number from FaceTime.
steps.content: Remove your phone number from FaceTime. To do so, tap the phone number you want to remove, then tap Remove to confirm.

steps.title: Return to Apps menu and select Messages.
steps.content: Return to Apps menu and select Messages . Tap the back buttons at the top-left corner until you've reached the list of apps, then tap Messages in the list.

steps.title: Tap Send & Receive.
steps.content: Tap Send & Receive . You'll see this under "iMessage."

steps.title: Remove the phone number.
steps.content: Remove the phone number. Tap the phone number, then tap Remove to delete it from iMessage. [4] X Research source If you want to stop using this phone number altogether, you can now also remove it from your Apple ID .

steps.title: Why is my iPhone still showing my old phone number?
steps.content: Why is my iPhone still showing my old phone number? This usually happens when your old phone number is still connected to FaceTime or the Messages app. You can remove your phone number from these apps in Settings > Apps > FaceTime and Settings > Apps > Messages .

steps.title: How do I hide my phone number on my iPhone?
steps.content: How do I hide my phone number on my iPhone? If you don't want people to see your iPhone phone number on their caller ID, you can turn off "Show My Caller ID" in Settings > Apps > Phone .

steps.title: How do I disable my iPhone phone number?
steps.content: How do I disable my iPhone phone number? If you want to stop receiving calls temporarily, you can turn on Do Not Disturb or Airplane Mode. To permanently disable your phone number, contact your mobile carrier.

steps.title: How do I remove a number from an old iPhone?
steps.content: How do I remove a number from an old iPhone? If you no longer have your iPhone, changing your password should deregister it from all your Apple devices. However, if you switched to Android from an iPhone and are having trouble receiving texts, you must deregister your phone number from iMessage at https://selfsolve.apple.com/deregister-imessage .
